channel.title: MYB
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from MYB, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Beyond Computer Vision, Brains In Jars, And How They See
item.description: New biological models are changing the game.

item.title: Okta Tightens Agent Identities For Machine-To-Machine Connections
item.description: Okta has introduced a new technology protocol to help secure AI agents.

item.title: Potential Medicaid Cuts Demand Action, Here’s How CIOs Can Step Up
item.description: With CMS and Medicaid budgets on the line, IT leaders must step up and collaborate with CFOs to streamline operations and maximize every dollar.

item.title: 5 Great Games For Less Than $5 In The Steam Summer Sale
item.description: There are several exceedingly cheap bargains to be had in the Steam summer sale. Here are five games that are worth downloading.

item.title: iPhone Fold: Apple’s Next Game-Changer Hits New Milestone, Report Says
item.description: A new report suggests that a folding iPhone is on schedule for launch in 2026.

item.title: Productivity, AI and pushback
item.description: Typesetters did not like the laser printer. Wedding photographers still hate the iphone. And some musicians are outraged that AI is now making mediocr...

item.title: Versions of reality
item.description: A sea slug sees far more colors than you do, and you probably see more than a profoundly color-blind person. Who’s right? We each carry our own versio...

item.title: Daydream fatigue
item.description: Spend enough time inventing possible futures in your head and you won’t have any time to build the future we will all share. Time to get to work.

item.title: A billion choices
item.description: Game theory has a lousy name. When most people think of games, they think of commercial stuff for kids, like Chutes and Ladders or possibly Monopoly. ...

item.title: Education is free, learning is expensive
item.description: That’s a complete reversal of how it used to be. Colleges used to be measured by how many books they had in the library. Access to courses was restric...
